Datatypes

　Variables do not have "types" in TJS2, but they do have types internally. It's more that types are handled automatically/dynamically, rather than not existing at all.
　Internal types include void, integer, real, string, object, and octet columns.

void

　void represents nothing (different from JavaScript). A freshly declared variable with no values assigned to it is void.
　For void comparisons, use the ==== (identification) operator.
　typeof 演算子は、これに対しては "void" を返します。
　In this case, the typeof operator for a "void" variable with a void type.

Integer type

　TJS2 can handle integers with 64 bit precision. Integers are normally treated as signed integers, with the sole exception of the >>> operator, which treats the left-hand side as an unsigned integer.
　In this case, the typeof operator returns with "Integer" for a variable with an integer type.

Real type

　TJS2 can handle real numbers with 64 bit precision (double precision real numbers) as a real number type.
　In this case, the typeof operator returns "Real" for a variable with a real type.

String type

　TJS2 can handle zero-terminated strings with no length limit. Zero-terminated strings mean that the string is assumed to end with \0.
　The character encoding handles wide characters (usually UNICODE), but whether 16-bit or 32-bit wide characters are used depends on the environment in which TJS2 was compiled. For example, on Windows, the character set is 16-bit, but on Solaris and Linux, the character set is 32-bit.
　In this case, the typeof operator returns "String" for a variable with a string type.

Object type

　Object types are types that hold objects. In addition to objects allocated with the new operator, functions, classes, and property objects are all object types.de">new 演算子で確保したオブジェクトのほか、関数、クラス、プロパティオブジェクトなどはすべてオブジェクト型になります。
　In this case, the typeof operator returns "Object" on a container with an object type.

　Unlike TJS and JavaScript, the object type in TJS2 has two pointers: one to the object itself and one to the object that is to be used as the context for the object. This allows for the implementation of so-called closures.The operator that changes this context portion is the incontextof operator.

Octet column type

　The octet column type handles 8-bit wide data strings.This is a type mainly for handling binary data.
　In this case, the typeof operator returns "Octet" for a variable with an octet type.
